If you're dead-seet on adding something, though, just do what Mastodon does for a second layer and call it a day. Your system is already fine.

talk.author: did:plc:55n4nhkcgvadrimff3myqvmw
talk.utter: Seriously. If I lose control of my domain, I'm in *big* trouble on a *variety* of fronts.

talk.author: did:plc:q3jopq5imjkocbqrnmxozm43
talk.utter: Yup. The domain is THE most secure way of doing this, because the only way you're losing that is somebody getting access to something that should be 1000% locked down. If they change that CNAME record, your URL's going to become a literal spam redirect within 10 minutes.
